helptips.title: IDV Help Tips
helptips.helptip:
The User's Guide contains a Getting Started section.

You can load one of the sample displays in the Displays->Favorite Bundles menu or select here:

  • Grid Display
  • Radar Display
  • Satellite Display

In the IDV, the process of analyzing and visualizing data takes the following steps:
  1. Choosing a Data Source.
  2. Selecting the parameter or diagnostic formula to use for the display.
  3. Selecting the type of display (and optionally selecting a range of times).
  4. Creating the display.
You can load in different sources of data through the Data->New Data Source... menu.
The Field Selector Window shows all of the loaded data sources and allows you to create new displays from the fields. View this window here.
You can zoom pan and rotate the display using the mouse and the keyboard. See Zooming, Panning, and Rotating.
You have control over time animation with the Time Animation Control.
If you have errors that need to be reported you can view the error message log from the Help->Show Console menu command.
You can save off the current state of the application (i.e., data, displays and settings) with the File->Save As... menu command. Read more about bundles in the User's Guide.
You can save the state of the IDV in a default bundle that will be used when you start the IDV. Read more about the "default bundle" in the User's Guide.
You can make computations using any data you can display in the IDV, using the IDV formula facility. Create formulas with the Formula Editor. See also User's Guide section about IDV formulas.
You can create and edit color tables with the IDV Color Table Editor. Read about the Color Table Editor and then invoke it with the Tools->Color Table Editor menu command.
You can change application preferences with the Edit->Preferences menu command. Read the User's Guide section on this topic.
You can add or change the set of background maps and projections of maps. Read the User's Guide section about this topic.
The IDV can use all the satellite data sets listed in Available Data.
You can toggle visibility of displays in several ways. See Toggling Visibility.
You can find distance and direction between two points on the earth's surface with the Range and Bearing tool.
You can attach descriptive text to any IDV display, and save it so others can see it, with Text Notes.
You can add range rings and azimuth lines to any radar display, or over any point on the map, with the Radar Range Rings.
You can write subroutines in Jython and use them to make computations on data with the Edit->Forumlas->Jython Library menu command. Read about Jythons methods in the User's Guide.
